name: The Crown Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night in an executive room at The Crown. I actually only booked a standard room & haggled them down to £105. When we checked in we were sent to an executive room. I don't know why we were upgraded but I was pleased. Our friends payed £165 for the same room which I'd say was a tad overpriced. The room was clean & cosy. The bathroom was fab with a jacuzzi bath. Not sure about the black loo paper but hey ho! My only 2 small gripes were the poor lighting in the bedroom, useless for putting your makeup on (but the bathroom was well lit) and although the bed was very comfortable, the pillows weren't so good. We got a complimentary food hamper with sweets & biscuits. Breakfast was really tasty. The reception area was well decorated & comfortable too.
reviews.title: Lovely, comfortable night at The Crown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I live just three miles away and have stayed at the Crown a few times as a treat and always been impressed. But recentley stayed and everything seems to have improved if that was possible.
reviews.title: The Ritz of the north

reviews.text: As soon as you enter the recption you know your in a special place. the reception staff where very proffesional and made you feel special even before you got to your room. We stayed in one of the executive rooms, 507, which has a wow factor as soon as you walk through the door.The decor is straight out of a designer magazine. Large bathroom with good size bath and double shower and well lit. The main room was a really good size with corner seating, raised bed with memory foam topper( if you just want to get away and sleep, this is the place to go), Large flat screen TV with good selection of free channels.
reviews.title: Hot room but apart from this it's fine!

reviews.text: We booked a table for 7.00 and the new look restaurant area added a special feeling and mood to eating. The staff where very attentive but knew when to leave you alone and dont constantly ask "is everything ok" with each mouthfull. They where knowledgable about the food being served and like good staff you did not know they where there but everything was delt with perfectly, keeping good traditions of politeness and old fashioned etiquet alive.
reviews.title: great brekkie and comfy beds

reviews.text: I really dont know where to start with the food. We shared a pate and onion chutney which was obviously home made and to die for. Then came the main course,I had the venison with root vegetable mash and my wife had belly pork and black pudding mash (wow wow WOW) we also ordered two side dishes and I dont know what has changed in the kitchen as the last time we stayed the food was good but this time a whole new level was reached. Even when we felt full we could not stop eating.
reviews.title: Not worthy of four star and doesn't warrant the price...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary - wow - we had an executive suite - it was amazing!!!! room 507 - we also decided to eat in the restaurant - although there was a wedding taking place it certainly did not affect the service - the food is amazing here at the Crown and if you havent eaten here recently go back as they are launching a new menu!! We had the sharing camembert cheese with rosemary and garlic - it was so amazing - fantastic- very filling that I wish I hadnt ordered a main .... the portions are so generous - I then had seafood risotto and my husband had fillet steak - he could not believe the size and quality of the steak - YOU MUST GO !!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that in our room there was an air conditioning unit that was very loud and the whole building could do with airconditioning but please dont let that put you off
reviews.title: Worst customer service for a 4 star hotel i have ever encountered...

reviews.text: Stayed overnight in a room not worthy of 4 star status, when i approached the Hotel Manager about certain issues i had he immediately became defensive, rude and very unapologetic. Certainly not a place i would consider staying in again. Obviously re training should be considered and maybe change in management.
reviews.title: Avoid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate dinner here in an empty restaurant, one other table. Our waiter was young and inexperienced and couldn't open our wine, our table was not table checked and I literally had to wander round to find then ask someone and ask for some pepper. I could hear our waitresses laughing and chatting from the kitchen.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not offered desserts, coffee or the bill. For this we also had to leave our seats.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: Advertising is very good, downstairs the breakfast is very good and the staff very friendly. BUT the rooms are very bad. The hot water transport pipes go through all the rooms (we stayed in several). Put blankets to cover them and get temperature down. In most rooms the windows cannot be opened. The beds are no good either. Management should spend time and money in the product 'sleep' and not in PR.
reviews.title: Excellent website, kitchen and staff, bad rooms

reviews.text: Again, kitchen very good and Bawtry is a lovely small town that deserved a good quality hotel!
reviews.title: Could be a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ah yes, and the wifi was for free and worked very well and each room has a modern flatscreen telly. For those who find this important ...
reviews.title: Best breakfast in a hotel for many years

reviews.text: The hotel has been refurbished & the public areas aswell as the bedrooms look like a luxurious boutique hotel BUT there are many things that are disappointing which the hotel could easily rectify :-.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money - not a 4 star hotel at all

reviews.text: 1 The rooms are very hot or freezing cold (radiators not in use)- it's pot luck which one you will get.
reviews.title: quality depend on which staff are on duty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our "executive room" was smaller than our kitchen at home. Very dark. Situated by communal door to corridor, so was awoken by late night revellers on more than one occasion. Upon opening the curtains we were greeted with a view of some back alley of corrugated roofs. Couldn't watch TV as it was facing the wrong direction on dressing table. Bar area ridiculously small with not much seating. Dinner okay but expensive. Breakfast, which was mediocre, was served before we had finished our cereal. Staff were friendly and helpful, but they'd have to be to make up for the lack of everything else about this hotel. Family stayed at the Premier Inn for a fraction of the price. Apparently breakfast there was superb. Wish we had joined them!
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a two night stay as we were attending a function in Bawtry. The first night we were kept awake until very late by by people attending a function gathering noisily outside beneath our window. As a wedding was being held there the following day and people had come to watch England play in the World Cup we decided to check out early.
reviews.title: If you are elderly don't go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being elderly it was impossible to climb over the the side of the bath which was steep sided. Apart from the fact we could not lift our legs high enough there were no hand rails.
reviews.title: You do not get what you pay for.

reviews.text: All this for £110 per night!
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I was invited to a wedding at this venue. The bride suggested that we stay here as it would be easy to come and go. She also told us she had negotiated the prices down. Well, we paid £90.00 for a standard double, which was about £15.00 off the regular rate. I was pretty shocked at that price- as I have stayed at many other establishements that were much cheaper and much more confortabale. For a starter, our shower had no water pressure. The lighting in the room was bad. The TV was only the standard channels(BBC 1&2, ITV and Channel 4) and the price for a movie was ridiculous. You had to pay for WIFI, which I was quite shocked by. Our room was very hot and stuffy. Luckily my partner is handy and could find a way to get the heat turned down himself. The bath room was small and the fixtures seemed tired. And, to top it all off we had to listen to a car auction for about 3 hours in the afternoon while trying to take a nap. The other problem was the hairdressers. Not the nicest thing to have to smell when walking back and forth to your room! The bar prices were high and the choices were poor to say the least.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the breakfast

description: The four star Crown Hotel is located in chic and cosmopolitan Bawtry. The hotel has been transformed with a rustic and contemporary style, with 77 bedrooms including sumptuous executive bedrooms with mood lighting, photographic wallpaper and sunken beds. The Crown restaurant open all day offers a locally sourced menu including grills, fish, pasta and its famous sharing platters, whilst the bustling Crown bar also offers a fizz menu and has a great atmosphere with candle lit lanterns and music. Bawtry is also right on the hotel doorstep and is renowned for its independent boutique shopping, restaurants and wine bars. The Crown is the perfect location to stay while visiting Doncaster Racecourse, Keepmoat Stadium / Doncaster Rovers, Doncaster Dome or when flying from Robin Hood Airport just 3 miles away.
